text:
What should you do if
you're towing a trailer and it
starts to swing from side to
side?

options.B: Brake hard and hold the pedal down
options.C: Let go of the steering wheel and let it correct itself
options.D: Ease off the accelerator to reduce your speed

explanation: Ease off the accelerator to reduce your speed. Don't brake hard or accelerate, as this will make the swinging worse. Gentle deceleration will stabilize the trailer.

text:
When would you increase
the pressure in your tyres so
that it's above the normal
value?

options.B: When the tyre tread is worn below 2 mm
options.C: When the vehicle is fitted with anti-lock brakes

explanation: When carrying a heavy load. Check your vehicle handbook for the correct tyre pressures when carrying heavy loads or towing.

text:
How will a heavy load on
your roof rack affect your
vehicle's handling?

options.A: It will improve the road holding
options.B: It will reduce the stopping distance
options.C: It will make the steering lighter

explanation: It will reduce stability. A heavy roof load raises the vehicle's centre of gravity, making it less stable, especially when cornering.

text:
Who's responsible for
making sure that a vehicle
isn't overloaded?

options.B: The person who loaded the vehicle
options.D: The owner of the items being carried

explanation: The driver of the vehicle. It's the driver's responsibility to ensure their vehicle isn't overloaded before starting any journey.

text:
You're planning to tow a
caravan. What will help the
handling of the
combination?

options.A: Power steering fitted to the towing vehicle
options.B: A stabiliser fitted to the tow bar
options.C: Anti-lock brakes fitted to the towing vehicle
options.D: A jockey wheel fitted to the tow bar

explanation: A stabiliser fitted to the tow bar. A stabiliser device helps reduce snaking and improves the stability of towing a caravan.

text:
Are passengers allowed
to ride in a caravan that's
being towed?

options.B: Only if a stabiliser is fitted
options.C: Only if all the seats in the towing vehicle are full

explanation: It will be less stable. A roof rack, especially when loaded, raises the centre of gravity and makes the vehicle less stable.

text:
You wish to tow a trailer.
Where would you find the
maximum noseweight for
your vehicle’s tow hitch?
explanation: Place the heavy items over the axles. This helps distribute weight evenly and maintains vehicle stability.

text:
How should a load be
carried on your roof rack?

options.C: Loaded towards the rear of the vehicle

explanation: Make sure the load is securely fastened. Unsecured loads can shift during driving, affecting handling and potentially falling off.

text:
You're carrying a child under three years old in 
your car. Which restraint is suitable for a child of this age?
explanation: It could make the tyres illegal. Overloading increases tyre wear and can cause damage, making them illegal to use.

text:
You’ve just passed your driving test. What’s the 
maximum authorised mass (MAM) of any trailer that you can tow?
explanation: The vehicle's handbook. The handbook provides the manufacturer's specific loading recommendations for your vehicle.

text:
What should you do
before you tow a trailer for
the first time?

options.A: Ask DVLA to update your licence
options.D: Fit P plates to your trailer

explanation: On top of the load. Securing over the top ensures the load stays in place even if lower straps loosen.

text:
You're going to tow a 
trailer that’s wider than your car. What must you fit to 
your car before you start 
towing it?
explanation: It will reduce steering control. Excess weight at the back can lift weight off the front wheels, reducing steering effectiveness.

text:
What must you do when
you hitch an unbraked trailer
to a towing vehicle?

options.B: Grease the tow ball and hitch
options.C: Switch off the reversing sensor on the towing vehicle
options.D: Make sure you can see the trailer in the mirrors

explanation: Become unstable when cornering. Uneven loading affects weight distribution and can cause the vehicle to handle unpredictably.

text:
What’s the minimum
depth of tread on the tyres
of a trailer?
explanation: Distribute it evenly. Even distribution maintains proper weight balance and vehicle stability.

text:
You’re about to start a journey towing a trailer.
What should you do if you notice that a light on your trailer is not working?

options.A: Disconnect the trailer electrical coupling before continuing with your journey
options.B: Repair the fault before continuing with your journey
options.C: Book the trailer in for repair before continuing with your journey
options.D: Continue with your journey because the lights on your car are working

explanation: Make sure it's securely fastened. All loads must be properly secured to prevent them shifting or falling off during transit.

text:
What does it mean if
your trailer has a maximum
authorised mass (MAM) of
3,500 kg?

options.A: Your trailer can carry a load of 3,500 kg
options.C: Your trailer and towing vehicle combined cannot weigh more than 3,500 kg
options.D: Your trailer and load combined cannot weigh more than 3,500 kg

explanation: Increase tyre pressure. When carrying extra weight, increased tyre pressure helps support the load and maintain proper handling.

text:
What should you do if
your trailer starts to swerve
or snake?
explanation: Your vehicle will be less stable. Heavy loads affect the centre of gravity and overall vehicle stability.

text:
How should you load
your trailer?

options.A: Put heavy items in the corners
options.B: Put heavy items over the axle(s)
options.C: Put heavy items at the back
options.D: Put heavy items at the front

explanation: Ease off the accelerator. Gentle deceleration is the safest way to regain control when a trailer starts to snake.
